cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles south of Camagüey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: continues west-northwest just south of Cuba today, then turns northwest into the Gulf of Mexico and toward the Texas-Louisiana coast mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Texas-Louisiana border along the north-west Gulf Coast

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Cuba, Cayman Islands, Florida Keys, and the north-west Gulf Coast (Texas-Louisiana) — NOT the U.S. Virgin Islands
weather_observation.wind: Any remaining gusts at St. Croix are expected to stay below gale force as the cyclone moves away.
weather_observation.rainfall: Scattered showers possible, but heavy rainfall core is now confined to Cuba and Jamaica.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and higher than normal surf may persist for another 12–18 hours.
